docs.snippet: Tim Duncan had 21 points and 10 rebounds, leading San Antonio past Miami, 110-95, on Thursday night in Game 1 at a steamy AT&T Center....

docs.abstract: San Antonio Spurs beat Miami Heat, 110-95, in Game 1 of NBA finals.

headline.main: Arena Is Sizzling, and So Are the Spurs in a Win to Open the Finals

docs.snippet: An air-conditioning failure on Thursday led to sweltering conditions in San Antonio’s arena in Game 1 of the finals, and the Heat’s LeBron James watched the final minutes with leg cramps....
docs.lead_paragraph: An air-conditioning failure on Thursday led to sweltering conditions in San Antonio’s arena in Game 1 of the finals, and the Heat’s LeBron James watched the final minutes with leg cramps.

headline.main: For Miami Heat and Spurs, Hot Arena Plays Big Role in Game 1

docs.snippet: Even if more Americans wind up rooting for the Spurs in the N.B.A. finals, the Heat will still have many more committed fans....

docs.abstract: Miami Heat have more fans than San Antonio Spurs, based on estimates derived from which teams people 'like' on Facebook; map gives a simple head-to-head comparison showing overwhelming support for the Heat.

headline.main: In Terms of Fans, the Heat Have Already Beaten the Spurs
headline.print_headline: If Fans Were Points, the Heat Would Beat the Spurs Easily
